purpose: To outline strategies for increasing usage by stimulating spend, growing balances, and building loyalty.
title: Increasing usage can be driven by strategies to stimulate spend, grow balances and build loyalty, which combine to build long-term cardholder value

tables.title: Strategies for Increasing Usage
tables.description: Details strategies to stimulate spend, grow balances responsibly, and build loyalty.

cells:
Drive frequent card usage
Drive broad card usage
Sustain card usage

Spend stimulation is best measured against two dimensions:
- Spend Velocity: Higher levels of total spend
- Category Breadth Expansion: Card use across a myriad of everyday and discretionary spend categories

Increase credit utilization
Increase ticket size and spend

Payment behaviors and credit utilization determine revolving balance growth opportunities
Provide special pricing promotions or extend payments over time to take advantage of borrowing capacity
- Balance transfers from other higher APR cards held
- Special APR and deferred interest promotions

Promote rewards
Nurture relationship and drive stickiness

Loyalty builds over time, as promises made by the promoted value proposition are realized by cardholders
Deepen customer stickiness to the issuer via cross-selling
Provide quality servicing, “have your customers’ backs,” and provide tools to simplify account management
